org.jcvi.jillion.core.io

Class IOUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jcvi.jillion.core.io.IOUtil

  • public final class IOUtil
extends Object
    IOUtil is a collection of static utility methods that make working with Input and Output easier.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Charset UTF_8
      Singleton for the Charset implementation for UTF-8.
      static String UTF_8_NAME
      "UTF-8"

    • Method Detail

      • recursiveDelete

        public static void recursiveDelete(File dir)
                            throws IOException
        Recursively delete the given directory. If the directory does not exist, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dir - the root directory to delete.
        Throws:
        IOException - if deleting the directory or a file under the directory fails.
        NullPointerException - if dir is null.

      • deleteChildren

        public static void deleteChildren(File dir)
                           throws IOException
        Recursively delete the given children (and only the children) of the given directory. If the directory does not exist, then this method does nothing.
        Parameters:
        dir - the root directory to delete.
        Throws:
        IOException - if deleting the directory or a file under the directory fails.
        NullPointerException - if dir is null.

      • delete

        public static void delete(File file)
                   throws IOException
        Deletes the given file and throws an Exception if the delete fails. This should be used in preference over File.delete() since that method returns a boolean result to indicate success or failure instead of throwing an exception. If the file does not exist, then this method will not do anything.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to be deleted; if this parameter is null, then method does nothing.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem deleting the file.
        See Also:
        deleteIgnoreError(File)

      • deleteIgnoreError

        public static void deleteIgnoreError(File file)
        Tries to delete the given File but doesn't check to see if the delete was successful. This is the same as calling File.delete() without checking the return value. If the file does not exist, then this method will not do anything.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to delete; if this parameter is null, then method does nothing.

      • mkdirs

        public static void mkdirs(File dir)
                   throws IOException
        Make the given directory and any non-existent parent directory as well. This method should be used in preference over File.mkdirs() since that method returns a boolean result to indicate success or failure instead of throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to be created; if dir is null or if it already exists, then this method does not do anything.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem making the directories.

      • mkdir

        public static void mkdir(File dir)
                  throws IOException
        Make the given directory. This method should be used in preference over File.mkdir() since that method returns a boolean result to indicate success or failure instead of throwing an exception.
        Parameters:
        dir - the directory to be created; if dir is null then this method does not do anything.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem making the directory.

      • closeAndIgnoreErrors

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(Closeable closeable)
        Close the given Closeable and ignore any IOExceptions that are thrown. Passing in a null will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        closeable - the Closeable object to close.

      • closeAndIgnoreErrors

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(Closeable... closeables)
        Convenience method for closing multiple Closeables at the same time, this method is the same as calling closeAndIgnoreErrors(Closeable) on each parameter.
        Parameters:
        closeables - the closeables to close.

      • closeAndIgnoreErrors

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(Statement statement)
        Close the given Statement and ignore any exceptions that are thrown. Passing in a null will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        statement - the Statement object to close

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(ResultSet resultSet)
        Close the given ResultSet and ignore any exceptions that are thrown. Passing in a null will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        resultSet - the ResultSet object to close

      • closeAndIgnoreErrors

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(Connection connection)
        Close the given Connection and ignore any exceptions that are thrown. Passing in a null will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        connection - the Connection object to close

      • closeAndIgnoreErrors

        public static void closeAndIgnoreErrors(Scanner scanner)
        Close the given Scanner and ignore any exceptions that are thrown. Passing in a null will do nothing.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the Scanner object to close

      • blockingSkip

        public static void blockingSkip(InputStream in,
                                long numberOfBytes)
                         throws IOException
        Skip numberOfBytes in the InputStream and block until those bytes have been skipped. InputStream.skip(long) will only skip as many bytes as it can without blocking.
        Parameters:
        in - InputStream to skip.
        numberOfBytes - number of bytes to skip.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputstream or if the end of file is reached before the number of bytes to skip has been reached.

      • blockingRead

        public static void blockingRead(InputStream in,
                                byte[] buf)
                         throws IOException
        Reads buf.length bytes of the given inputStream and puts them into the given byte array starting at the given offset. Will keep reading until length number of bytes have been read (possibly blocking). This is the same as blockingRead(in,buf,0, buf.length)
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to read; can not be null.
        buf - the byte array to write the data from the stream to; can not be null.
        Throws:
        EOFException - if EOF is unexpectedly reached.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the stream.
        NullPointerException - if either inputStream or buf are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if either offset or length are negative.
        See Also:
        blockingRead(InputStream, byte[], int, int)

      • blockingRead

        public static void blockingRead(RandomAccessFile file,
                                byte[] buf)
                         throws IOException
        Reads buf.length bytes of the given RandomAccessFile starting at the current file pointer and puts them into the given byte array starting at the given offset. Will keep reading until length number of bytes have been read (possibly blocking). This is the same as blockingRead(in,buf,0, buf.length)
        Parameters:
        file - the RandomAccessFile to read; can not be null.
        buf - the byte array to write the data from the stream to; can not be null.
        Throws:
        EOFException - if EOF is unexpectedly reached.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the stream.
        NullPointerException - if either inputStream or buf are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if either offset or length are negative.
        See Also:
        blockingRead(RandomAccessFile, byte[], int, int)

      • blockingRead

        public static void blockingRead(InputStream in,
                                byte[] buf,
                                int offset,
                                int length)
                         throws IOException
        Reads up to length number of bytes of the given inputStream and puts them into the given byte array starting at the given offset. Will keep reading until length number of bytes have been read (possibly blocking).
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to read; can not be null.
        buf - the byte array to write the data from the stream to; can not be null.
        offset - the offset into the byte array to begin writing bytes to must be >= 0.
        length - the maximum number of bytes to read, must be >= 0. This number of bytes will be read unless the inputStream ends prematurely (which will throw an IOException).
        Throws:
        EOFException - if EOF is unexpectedly reached.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the stream.
        NullPointerException - if either inputStream or buf are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if either offset or length are negative.

      • blockingRead

        public static void blockingRead(RandomAccessFile file,
                                byte[] buf,
                                int offset,
                                int length)
                         throws IOException
        Reads up to length number of bytes of the given RandomAccessFile starting at the current file pointer and puts them into the given byte array starting at the given offset. Will keep reading until length number of bytes have been read (possibly blocking).
        Parameters:
        file - the RandomAccessFile to read; can not be null.
        buf - the byte array to write the data from the stream to; can not be null.
        offset - the offset into the byte array to begin writing bytes to must be >= 0.
        length - the maximum number of bytes to read, must be >= 0. This number of bytes will be read unless the inputStream ends prematurely (which will throw an IOException).
        Throws:
        EOFException - if EOF is unexpectedly reached.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the stream.
        NullPointerException - if either inputStream or buf are null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if either offset or length are negative.

      • switchEndian

        public static byte[] switchEndian(byte[] byteArray)
        This method makes a new byte array that contains the same data as the input byte array, but the endian is reversed.
        Parameters:
        byteArray - the input byte array to change the endian of.
        Returns:
        a new byte array which represents the same data as the passed in array, but with the endian switched. (Big Endian to Little Endian or vice versa)

      • convertUnsignedIntToByteArray

      • convertUnsignedShortToByteArray

        public static byte[] convertUnsignedShortToByteArray(int unsignedShort)
        Convert an unsigned short into a fully padded byte array.

        For Example: 

         
 3 => [0, 3]
 255 => [0, 255]
 256 => [1, 255]
        Parameters:
        unsignedShort - the value of the unsigned value to convert; must be ≥ 0.
        Returns:
        a new byte array.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if unsignedShort is negative.

      • getUnsignedBitCount

        public static int getUnsignedBitCount(long value)
        Get the number of bits required to represent this value in binary.
        Parameters:
        value - the value as an positive long.
        Returns:
        the number of bits that are required to represent this value as an unsigned binary integer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is negative.

      • getUnsignedByteCount

        public static int getUnsignedByteCount(long value)
        Get the number of bytes required to represent this value in binary.
        Parameters:
        value - the value as an positive long.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that are required to represent this value as an unsigned binary integer.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if value is negative.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(BitSet bitset,
                                 int bitLength)
        Convert the given BitSet into the corresponding byte array. For some reason BitSet Java API thru java 6 does not include methods for converting to and from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bitset - the bitset to convert.
        bitLength - the number of bits that need to be present in the byte array. This needs to be specified because a BitSet may have trailing 0's which would get truncated otherwise.
        Returns:
        a new byte array containing the smallest number of bytes required to store the same data as the given BitSet.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bitset is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if bitLength is negative.

      • toBitSet

        public static BitSet toBitSet(byte[] bytes)
        Convert the given byte array into the corresponding BitSet using the least number of bits possible. For some reason BitSet Java API thru java 6 does not include methods for converting to and from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte array to convert.
        Returns:
        a new BitSet containing the same data as the given byte array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bytes is null.

      • toBitSet

        public static BitSet toBitSet(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Convert the given byte array into the corresponding BitSet using the least number of bits possible. For some reason BitSet Java API thru java 6 does not include methods for converting to and from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuffer to convert.
        Returns:
        a new BitSet containing the same data as the given byte array.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if bytes is null.

      • toBitSet

        public static BitSet toBitSet(long singleValue)
        Convert the given single value into the corresponding BitSet using the least number of bits possible. For some reason BitSet Java API thru java 6 does not include methods for converting to and from a byte array.
        Parameters:
        singleValue - the value to convert.
        Returns:
        a new BitSet containing the same data as the given byte array.

      • copy

        public static long copy(InputStream in,
                        OutputStream out)
                 throws IOException
        Copy the contents of the given inputStream to the given outputStream. This method buffers internally so there is no need to use a BufferedInputStream. This method does not close either stream after processing.
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to read.
        out - the outputStream to write to.
        Returns:
        the number of bytes that were copied.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading or writing the streams.
        NullPointerException - if either stream is null.

      • toString

        public static String toString(InputStream in)
                       throws IOException
        Read the contents of the given InputStream using the default character encoding and return the entire contents of the stream as a String. This method will not close the stream when it is done. There is no need to buffer the InputStream since this method will buffer internally.
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to read as a String; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a String representing the contents of the given String using the default character encoding.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the Stream.
        NullPointerException - if inputStream is null.

      • toString

        public static String toString(InputStream in,
                              String encoding)
                       throws IOException
        Read the contents of the given InputStream using the default character encoding and return the entire contents of the stream as a String. This method will not close the stream when it is done. There is no need to buffer the InputStream since this method will buffer internally.
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to read as a String; can not be null.
        encoding - the name of the Charset encoding to use; if this value is null, then use the default as defined by Charset.defaultCharset().
        Returns:
        a String representing the contents of the given String using the default character encoding.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the InputStream or the charset encoding.
        NullPointerException - if inputStream is null.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(File f)
                          throws IOException
        Copy the contents of the given File and return it as a byte[].
        Parameters:
        f - the File to get the bytes of.
        Returns:
        a new byte array instance containing all the bytes from the given file.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(InputStream input)
                          throws IOException
        Copy the contents of the given InputStream and return it as a byte[].
        Parameters:
        input - the inputStream to convert into a byte[]. This stream is not closed when the method finishes.
        Returns:
        a new byte array instance containing all the bytes from the given inputStream.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the Stream.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(InputStream in,
                                 int numberOfBytesToRead)
                          throws IOException
        Copy the numberOfBytesToRead of the given InputStream and return it as a byte[]. This is the same as toByteArray(in,numberOfBytesToRead,ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN)
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to convert into a byte[]. This stream is not closed when the method finishes.
        numberOfBytesToRead - the number of bytes to read from the stream; if there aren't enough bytes, then this method will block until more bytes are available or until the stream reaches end of file (which will cause an IOException to be thrown).
        Returns:
        a new byte array instance containing all the bytes from the given inputStream.
        Throws:
        EOFException - if the end of the file is reached before the given number of bytes.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputStream.

      • toByteArray

        public static byte[] toByteArray(InputStream in,
                                 int numberOfBytesToRead,
                                 ByteOrder endian)
                          throws IOException
        Copy the numberOfBytesToRead of the given InputStream and return it as a byte[] using the given ByteOrder.
        Parameters:
        in - the inputStream to convert into a byte[]. This stream is not closed when the method finishes.
        numberOfBytesToRead - the number of bytes to read from the stream; if there aren't enough bytes, then this method will block until more bytes are available or until the stream reaches end of file (which will cause an IOException to be thrown).
        endian - the ByteOrder to use; null is considered ByteOrder.BIG_ENDIAN (the default).
        Returns:
        a new byte array instance containing all the bytes from the given inputStream.
        Throws:
        EOFException - if the end of the file is reached before the given number of bytes.
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the inputStream.

      • computeNumberOfBitsIn

        public static int computeNumberOfBitsIn(int value)
        Compute the number of bits required to store the given value. For example the value 2 requires 2 bits and the value 6 requires 3 bits etc.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to get the number of bits for.
        Returns:
        the number of bits needed.

      • toInputStream

        public static InputStream toInputStream(String input)
        Convenience method for toInputStream(String, Charset) using UTF-8 charset.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to turn into an inputStream; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new InputStream instance; will never be null, but may be empty.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if input is null.

      • toInputStream

        public static InputStream toInputStream(String input,
                                        Charset charset)
        Create a new InputStream of the bytes of the given String using the given Charset.
        Parameters:
        input - the String to turn into an inputStream; can not be null.
        charset - the Charset to use to convert the characters in the String into bytes; can not be null.
        Returns:
        a new InputStream instance; will never be null, but may be empty.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if either parameters are null.

      • createTempDir

        public static File createTempDir(String prefix,
                                 String suffix,
                                 File directory)
                          throws IOException
        Similar to File.createTempFile(String, String, File) but makes a directory instead. The contract of File.createTempFile(String, String, File) is respected:

        Creates a new empty file in the specified directory, using the given prefix and suffix strings to generate its name. If this method returns successfully then it is guaranteed that:

        1. The file denoted by the returned abstract pathname did not exist before this method was invoked, and
        2. Neither this method nor any of its variants will return the same abstract pathname again in the current invocation of the virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        prefix - The prefix string to be used in generating the file's name; must be at least three characters long
        suffix - The suffix string to be used in generating the file's name; may be null, in which case the suffix ".tmp" will be used
        directory - The directory in which the file is to be created, or null if the default temporary-file directory is to be used. If the directory is not null and does not exist, then it will be created.
        Returns:
        a new File object that points to this new created directory.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the directory.

      • verifyIsReadable

        public static void verifyIsReadable(File f)
                             throws IOException
        Checks to make sure the given file is readable and throws an descriptive IOException if it's not.
        Parameters:
        f - the File to verify; can not be null
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if f is null.
        FileNotFoundException - if the file does not exist.
        IOException - if the file is not readable.

      • createNewBufferedReader

        public static BufferedReader createNewBufferedReader(File file,
                                                     String charset)
                                              throws IOException
        Create a new BufferedReader instance that reads the given file in the given Charset.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to read.
        charset - the name of the Charset to use.
        Returns:
        a new BufferedReader.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem reading the file or translating the charset name into a Charset.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.

      • createNewBufferedWriter

        public static BufferedWriter createNewBufferedWriter(File file,
                                                     String charset)
                                              throws IOException
        Create a new BufferedWriter instance that reads the given file in the given Charset.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to, will be overwritten; can not be null.
        charset - the name of the Charset to use.
        Returns:
        a new BufferedWriter.
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem creating the file or translating the charset name into a Charset.
        NullPointerException - if either parameter is null.
